alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 5:34PM EDT until June 29 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Somerset County in west central Maine... * Until 845 PM EDT. * At 534 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Rockwood and Moosehead vicinity. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and state highway department. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Misery Gore, Sapling, Taunton And Raynham Academy Grant, Indian Stream, Rockwood Strip, Misery, Sandwich Academy Grant, Chase Stream and Tomhegan. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
